title: Riot Support is Broken

replies.body:
Hey there,

First let's address your support login issue, I'm currently able to log in fine.

* Have you attempted to log in with a different browser? 
* Have you tried an "incognito" window in your current browser? 
* Does logging in work as expected when trying the steps above?

Next onto your connection issues, that's definitely odd. Could you do the following for me.

* [Download WinMTR](https://sourceforge.net/projects/winmtr/files/WinMTR-v092.zip/download) and run a traceroute to the following IP. (Allow this to run for 5-15 minutes)
  * 103.240.227.5
* Once adequate time has passed, stop the traceroute, export your results as text.
* Run the [ICSI netalyzr](http://netalyzr.icsi.berkeley.edu/).
* Email a link to your WinMTR results (You can use [pastebin](http://pastebin.com/) for this) and the ICSI netalyzr results link to **oce-wrenchmen@googlegroups.com** don't forget to include a link to your thread in the email :)

Hey Sephiroth, sorry for the delayed response.
As for the former half of your response, as I've said somewhere else (probably reddit) I've tried those all before and I've now had success getting into support, through the standard route i'd take after contact with Riot Mindstar.

As for the Connection issues Netalyser isn't available for me(after numerous attempts)  in QLD. 
and I had a bit of an issue with WinMTR also, but i'll send that regardless.

Its on its way now.

As to follow-up, I received this email shortly after sending:
> "Hello eric31155@gmail.com,
> 
>  We're writing to let you know that the group you tried to contact (oce-wrenchmen) may not exist, or you may not have permission to post messages to the group. A few more details on why you weren't able to post:
> 
>   * You might have spelled or formatted the group name incorrectly.
>   * The owner of the group may have removed this group.
>   * You may need to join the group before receiving permission to post.
>   * This group may not be open to posting.
> 
>  If you have questions related to this or any other Google Group, visit the Help Center at https://groups.google.com/support/.
> 
>  Thanks,
> 
>  Google Groups"

So i'll just post the email here:
> "Hey Wrenchmen,

Thanks

Hey there,

Good to hear you've got a ticket open with support now, they should be able to help you out.

I don't see anything visibly wrong with that traceroute, however it might be worth it to contact your ISP and see if there is a known routing issue to the IP listed above.

Also thanks for the info re; the googlegroups email, i'll have it looked into ASAP.
